page.title: 16Transport continued
page.content: where there are connections to Oxford, Reading and London. There are no buses in the evening and there is no transport betwen Ewelme and BEnson Village. Many families and the children especially have bicycles, BMX bikes are of particular appeal to the children. Motorbikes and mopeds provide transport, especially for teenagers. Ewelme plays host to many articulated lorries and tankers which bring raw ingredients to and collect processed honey from Rowse's Honey factory in the centre of the village. Each Tuesday household refuse is collected by a private companys vans The Mobile Library comes to village fortnightly on Mondays. Post Office vehicles collect mail twice daily from te post office and other letter boxes. Newspapers are delivered daily in village. There is a milk distribution
